text:
I'm using an Apache front-end w/ SSL enabled to my internal servers. However, 
when using the option "ProxyPreserveHost on", the protocol part of the response 
headers is not rewritten with ProxyPassReverse.

Without the ProxyPreserveHost option, the response headers are correctly 
rewritten by mod_proxy.

Thanks
creator: rmiranda@solar.com.br
rpluem@apache.org
text:
httpd 2.0.58 has serveral proxy code fixes. Some of them are security fixes that
are especially important for reverse proxies (CVE-2005-2088). Please check if
the problem is still there with httpd 2.0.58. Do not try to use httpd 2.0.55 as
this has a regression (#37145) which causes reverse proxies not to work with ssl.

I have the same configuration running Apache2.2.3 and have exactly the same problem
